title: Watch: 4-hour sandstorm in China documented through TikTok
description: Several towns in China were hit with a significant sandstorm for almost 4 hours. The storm was documented by residents and tourists on social media.

title: CNN gets first look at a captured Russian drone. See what was found inside
description: CNN's Nic Robertson shows how Western technology used in drones is helping Russia to track and kill Ukrainian forces.

title: Why MI6 chief thinks Russia is running 'out of steam' on war in Ukraine
description: MI6 chief Richard Moore talks to CNN's Jim Sciutto about Russian President Vladimir Putin's "epic fails" in Ukraine and why he thinks Russia is running "out of steam."

title: Watch Lizzo improvise personalized songs for fans
description: Lizzo made an appearance on "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" for a segment called "Undercover Sing" where she surprises fans with improvised versions of her most popular tunes.

title: Passengers climb through windows, jump off bridge to escape burning train
description: The MBTA evacuated 200 people after an Orange Line train near Boston lit up in smoke and flames. No one was injured and the incident is under investigation.

title: Cubans wait for days in line to buy diesel
description: Cubans are waiting in lines for days for diesel fuel amid a massive countrywide shortage. CNN's Patrick Oppmann reports.

title: US President Joe Biden tests positive for Covid, White House says
description: President Joe Biden has tested positive for Covid-19 and is experiencing "mild symptoms," White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre said Thursday.,

title: Russian and European astronauts to conduct rare joint spacewalk
description: Two astronauts — one European and one Russian — will put on puffy white spacesuits and exit the airlock on the International Space Station for a spacewalk on Thursday, marking the first time in more than 20 years such a joint endeavor has taken place.

title: 'I want this for everybody:' Lizzo makes statement in Balenciaga caution tape for Elle cover shoot
description: Wrapped in the Balenciaga yellow caution tape that Kim Kardashian wore during Paris Fashion Week in March, Lizzo's latest cover shoot is dominating social media feeds.

title: DHS watchdog tells Secret Service to stop missing texts probe
Italy's president dissolves parliament, triggering snap election following Draghi's resignation
description: Italy's President Sergio Mattarella dissolved parliament on Thursday, triggering a snap election following the resignation of the country's Prime Minister Mario Draghi earlier in the day.

title: Amazon to buy One Medical for $3.9 billion as it expands healthcare footprint
description: Amazon on Thursday said it had entered an agreement to acquire primary healthcare company One Medical in an all-cash deal valued at approximately $3.9 billion.

title: Kelp is on the way: Why we should all be eating seaweed
description: When most of us read the words "plant-based diet," we tend to think of foods such as kale salads and grain bowls or trendy meat replacements. But there is one nonmeat option that's gaining traction as the newest superfood: seaweed.

title: Proud Boys crashed Drag Queen Story Hour at a local library. It was part of a wider movement
description: A version of this story appeared in CNN's Race Deconstructed newsletter. To get it in your inbox every week, sign up for free here.

title: A New York man who allegedly punched an Asian woman more than 100 times has been indicted on hate crimes charges
description: A man allegedly seen in surveillance video punching an elderly Asian woman more than 100 times and stomping on her body in Yonkers, New York, has been indicted on multiple hate crime charges.

title: YouTube will start removing misinformation related to abortion
description: YouTube on Thursday said it will no longer allow misinformation related to abortion on its platform, including false claims about the safety of the procedure and potentially unsafe instructions about how to self-induce an abortion.

title: ECB raises rates for the first time in 11 years
description: In a bold move to get inflation under control, the European Central Bank on Thursday announced it would raise its key interest rate by a half percentage point.

title: Analysis: CIA chief: Putin 'entirely too healthy.' What we know
description: CIA Director Bill Burns gave an unusually candid assessment this week, when he told attendees at the Aspen Institute's annual security confab that Russian President Vladimir Putin is "entirely too healthy."

title: Beyoncé releases new album track list
description: The countdown to Beyoncé's new album just got more exciting.

title: War and energy woes push the climate crisis to the back seat in an endless vicious cycle
description: As Russia resumed its supply of natural gas to Germany after weeks of what it called "maintenance" on its Nord Stream 1 pipeline, leaders in Berlin breathed a sigh of relief. A day earlier, US President Joe Biden chose to defer declaring a climate emergency, which could have unleashed a wave of resources to fight the crisis, despite his opponents torpedoing his plans.

title: The poll question every expert is obsessed with in 2022
description: The 2022 midterm elections are just more than three months away. Most signs suggest it's going to be a good election year for Republicans -- including the so-called "generic ballot." But why do political pros put so much faith in a single question? And is it really as predictive of future outcomes as everyone seems to think?

title: More Americans who want abortions are turning to Mexico for help
description: Verónica Cruz says she's been getting frantic calls from women in the United States.

title: The CIA chief says Putin is 'entirely too healthy.' What do we really know about his condition?
'Nope' puts Jordan Peele's quirky spin on an alien-invasion thriller
description: Jordan Peele's "Get Out" marked such a thrilling directing debut that the pretty-good things he's done in the five years since, including "Us" and a full plate of TV shows, have felt somewhat less exciting by comparison. "Nope," another monosyllabic title, initially seems destined to buck that trend, but turns out to be fun without sustaining its promise from start to finish.

title: Spurred by world's 'uncertainty,' Michelle Obama announces new book
description: Prompted by a series of national crises and global anxiety, Michelle Obama has written a new book, the former first lady announced Thursday via Twitter.

title: Dave Chappelle show canceled by venue hours before performance
description: Hours before Dave Chappelle was set to hit the stage in Minneapolis, the venue canceled the sold-out show.

title: Facebook is redesigning the home feed
description: Facebook's rumored redesign has arrived.

title: BA.5 is causing more Covid-19 reinfections, data suggests, but they don't appear to be more frequent
This designer is turning balloons into fine furniture
description: Plump, plush and -- for want of a better word -- squishy fittings have dominated homes and Instagram feeds alike since the 1970s design revival began approximately two years ago. Vogue anointed puffy furniture "2021's most delightful home trend" last May, while the New York Times offered up the pervasiveness of squidgy couches, chairs and poufs as akin to the pandemic-induced sweatpant craze of 2020. A velvet '70s armchair by Tobia and Afra Scarpa -- "the Soriana" -- can set you as far back as £6,461 (around $7,800), while a perfectly rendered doughnut pouf by New Zealand designer Sabine Marcelis costs €1,599 ($1,640).

title: Here's what it looks like to ride a Chinese robotaxi with no steering wheel
description: Baidu has unveiled plans for an electric self-driving car with a removable steering wheel, marking another step forward in the fast-moving robotaxi race in China.

title: Starbucks can't be America's public bathroom
description: Twenty years ago, then-New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg was under pressure to build more public bathrooms. He responded with an answer that represents how most of the United States has handled public bathroom access for decades.

title: American and United airlines return to profitability
description: American and United airlines both reported their first operating profit since the start of the pandemic, as strong demand for air travel and high fares allowed the carriers to overcome rising fuel prices.

title: Netflix's vision for the future of streaming: More expensive or less convenient
description: Netflix lost roughly a million customers last quarter — the most in the company's 25-year history. But it stopped the bleeding in a nightmarish year, and the company believes that its new long-term initiatives will boost sales and subscribers.

title: Europe's historic inflation fight begins now
description: The European Central Bank is about to raise interest rates for the first time in 11 years as it attempts to put a lid on record inflation fed by surging energy prices.

title: Two suspects arrested over $1.6M wine heist at Spanish hotel
description: Spanish police have detained a pair of professional thieves accused of stealing more than $1.6 million worth of wine from a hotel in the south of the country.

title: Workers aren't having to settle for part-time work any more
description: Part-time work has become a lot less popular, both with job seekers and employers.

title: Watch AG speak on the possibility of charging Donald Trump
description: Attorney General Merrick Garland made his strongest comments yet about whether he'll charge former President Donald Trump saying that 'no person is above the law.' CNN's S.E. Cupp, John Avlon and Jeffrey Toobin discuss.

title: Luxury shoemaker Manolo Blahnik wins 22-year trademark battle in China
description: Manolo Blahnik, the shoe brand made famous by its celebrity fans and regular appearances in TV drama "Sex and the City," said on Tuesday it has won a legal battle in China to use its own name, paving the way for the brand's expansion across the country.

title: Women's Euro 2022: England beats Spain 2-1 in a dramatic extra-time performance
description: Trailing Spain 1-0 with six minutes of regular time left, England seemed to be exiting its home Women's Euro until Ella Toone knocked home an equalizer that lifted a raucous, record crowd of 28,994 spectators inside the Brighton and Hove Community Stadium to their feet and dragged the quarterfinal to extra time.

title: Rescuers heaved a massive sea turtle back into the ocean after it got stuck on a beachfront patio
description: After a large green sea turtle wandered onto a beachfront patio in Florida, it needed a little help from local rescuers to find it's way back to sea.

title: The climate crisis is driving heat waves and wildfires. Here's how
description: Brutal heat waves are gripping both Europe and the United States this week and are forecast to dump searing temperatures on much of China into late August.

title: Meet the amateur team helping South Korea break out of its old prejudice and embrace women's football
description: For a long time in South Korea, there was a stereotype that football was too competitive for women. Girls were often told to behave modestly and physical education teachers would give footballs to boys and dodge balls to girls without hesitation or question.

title: See why health workers in China are hugging giants blocks of ice
description: Extreme heat has made China's zero-covid policy much more difficult - and dangerous - for front line health care workers. CNN's Selina Wang reports.

title: Novak Djokovic and Serena Williams on US Open entry lists -- but that doesn't mean they'll play
description: Serena Williams is included on the entry list for this year's US Open, along with 21-time grand slam champion Novak Djokovic, who is currently unable to enter the country due to rules that require travelers to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19.

title: Magnus Carlsen says he has no 'inclination' to defend his world championship title next year
description: Magnus Carlsen says he will not defend his world championship title next year against Russia's Ian Nepomniachtchi because he has no motivation to play the match.

title: One man has photographed 13,000 species
description: A spoon-billed sandpiper steps into the frame, heading straight for a small bug placed there as bait. It sweeps up its food with its spoon-shaped beak and exits stage-left.

title: His wife was killed in front of him as Russian troops entered his home. Why he now blames Ukraine
description: CNN's Matthew Chance gets an exclusive look at the filtration process for Ukrainian refugees on Russian soil, and speaks to them about their experiences.
